list.name: TAP Events
list.query: select title, message, eventTags from "tap.events"  where "type" =~ /^$events$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "cluster" =~/^$cluster$/ AND "environment" =~/^$env$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.description:
This panel shows the request rate at the load balancers that are routed to the selected server groups.
The default is to show the per second request rate, averaged over a 1 minute moving window.

Additional windows (5m, 15m) can be enabled by editing this graph and enabling the corresponding metric.

targets.query: SELECT sum("requests") AS "total_requests" FROM (SELECT mean("rate.1m") AS "requests"  FROM "loadbalancer.app.requests" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND lb_type != 'envoy') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "server_group", host fill(null)) WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "server_group" fill(linear)

panels.title: Request Rate by Server Group

panels.description: This panel shows request latency at the load balancer for the selected clusters.  It uses a weighted avg of latency.avg to determine overall latency for the application.
panels.title: Avg Request Latency by Application

panels.description:
This panel shows request latency at the load balancer for the selected clusters.
By default, the panel shows the 95th and 99th percentile averages mean that 95 and 99% of requests will fall at or below the value respectively.

The load balancers report additional metrics that may be helpful: latency.avg, latency.p50, latency.p75, latency.p90, latency.stddev
panels.title: Approximate Request Latency (P95 & P99) by Application

panels.description:
This graph shows API request rate by host and request path at the application. The values on this graph are stacked such that the summation of the values should be equivalent to the request rate for the cluster as reported by the load balancer.

The values on this graph are requests per second, but the data points for the application may be reported at a slower rate (default of 10s). This means that the value displayed here is the per second average between 2 successive reports.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("count"), 1s) FROM "2xx" WHERE "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "path" != '/health' AND "path" !~ /.*favicon\.ico/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "environment", "server_group", "path","host" fill(previous) offset 1

SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("count"), 1s) FROM "3xx" WHERE "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "path" != '/health' AND "path" !~ /.*favicon\.ico/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "environment", "server_group", "path","host" fill(previous) offset 1

SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("count"), 1s) FROM "4xx" WHERE "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "path" != '/health' AND "path" !~ /.*favicon\.ico/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "environment", "server_group", "path","host" fill(previous) offset 1

SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("count"), 1s) FROM "5xx" WHERE "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "path" != '/health'  AND "path" !~ /.*favicon\.ico/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "environment", "server_group", "path","host" fill(previous) offset 1

panels.title: API Access Counts

panels.description: This panel reports on exceptions found in the logs of your application. Due to intense processing time required to filter and tag application logs, this metric can lag. If you are looking for timely alerting on this metric, you may instead opt to create a custom metric for your exceptions by following the custom metric section in TAP Docs.
panels.title: Exception Count

panels.description:
Shows the health status of instances associated with the selected application and environment.

The health indicated here is a combination of the application's health check (including the go-proxy if the workload is proxy enabled) and the Consul cluster node check (Serf check). Healthy status indicates that the instance will be used as a backend instance by the load balancers IF the server group containing the instance is enabled.

Unhealthy instances will not receive traffic from the load balancers. However, if a client has established a long lived connection, it may retain it's connection to an unhealthy backend.
panels.title: Current Health Status

panels.description:
This graph shows the health status of instances for the selected cluster over time. A reported value of 1 indicates that the instance is Unhealthy during that time. A value of 0 indicates that instance was healthy.

This graph is useful to see if instances a "flapping" health which would cause them to be continuously pulled in and out of service in the load balancers. "Flapping" health is likely an indicator of either resource constraints (CPU/Memory) or of instability in a downstream dependency.

See https://pages.git.target.com/measurement/documentation/services/alerting/alerting-from-grafana.html to learn how to set up an alert

targets.query: SELECT sum("value") FROM "upagent.healthcheck" WHERE ("environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "host", "check" fill(null)

panels.title: Health Check - State

panels.description:
This graph shows if any instance has transitioned in or out of health over time. This is useful if your health status is flapping extremely quickly.

This graph is useful to see if instances a "flapping" health which would cause them to be continuously pulled in and out of service in the load balancers. "Flapping" health is likely an indicator of either resource constraints (CPU/Memory) or of instability in a downstream dependency.

See https://pages.git.target.com/measurement/documentation/services/alerting/alerting-from-grafana.html to learn how to set up an alert

targets.query: SELECT sum("value") FROM "upagent.healthcheck" WHERE ("environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "host", "check" fill(null)

panels.title: Health Check - Transitions

panels.description:
This graph shows how long any instance takes to respond back to your health check. This can be useful for adjusting the timeout value of your health check.

See https://pages.git.target.com/measurement/documentation/services/alerting/alerting-from-grafana.html to learn how to set up an alert

targets.query: SELECT sum("value") FROM "upagent.healthcheck" WHERE ("environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "host", "check" fill(null)

panels.title: Health Check - Latency

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "memory.heap.usage" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi' AND "environment" =~ /^$environment$/ AND "stack" =~ /^$stack$/ AND "detail" =~ /^$detail$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "memory.heap.usage" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi' AND "environment" =~ /^$environment$/ AND "stack" =~ /^$stack$/ AND "detail" =~ /^$detail$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "memory.heap.usage" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi' AND "environment" =~ /^$environment$/ AND "stack" =~ /^$stack$/ AND "detail" =~ /^$detail$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "memory.heap.usage" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi' AND "environment" =~ /^$environment$/ AND "stack" =~ /^$stack$/ AND "detail" =~ /^$detail$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "memory.heap.usage" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi' AND "environment" =~ /^$environment$/ AND "stack" =~ /^$stack$/ AND "detail" =~ /^$detail$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "memory.heap.usage" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi' AND "environment" =~ /^$environment$/ AND "stack" =~ /^$stack$/ AND "detail" =~ /^$detail$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "memory.heap.usage" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi' AND "environment" =~ /^$environment$/ AND "stack" =~ /^$stack$/ AND "detail" =~ /^$detail$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("value"), 1s) FROM "garbage.G1-Old-Generation.count" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "server_group", "host" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("value"), 1s) FROM "garbage.G1-Young-Generation.count" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "server_group", "host" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("value"), 1s) FROM "garbage.PS-MarkSweep.time" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "server_group", "host" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("value"), 1s) FROM "garbage.PS-Scavenge.count" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "server_group", "host" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("value"), 1s) FROM "garbage.G1-Old-Generation.time" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "server_group", "host" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("value"), 1s) FROM "garbage.G1-Young-Generation.time" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "server_group", "host" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)

panels.description:
Metrics on object resource pools backed by the Apache Commons Pool 2 library. Many connection pools (such as database or redis) will utilize this library under the hood. 

These metrics will show the maximum number of allocatable resources in the pool, the current number leased from the pool, and the number of callers that are blocked waiting to get an object from the pool.

targets.query: SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "resourcePools.active" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "type", "name" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)

panels.title: Resource Pools

targets.query: SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)
SELECT count("count") FROM "2xx" WHERE ("application" = 'tapi') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "stack" fill(null)

panels.description:
This graph shows the CPU usage for the selected clusters. The percentage shown is per core and show not exceed the allocated CPU for the workload.

For example, if a workload is configured with 2000 millicores, then this graph should not exceed 200% with indicates full usage on 2 cores (where each core has 1000 millicores).

targets.query: SELECT mean("usage_percent") FROM "docker_container_cpu" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "host" fill(null)

panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description:
This panel shows the amount of cpu periods being throttled in percentage.  Some throttling is normal for container based workloads. However, excessive amounts of throttling typically indicate that the workload is attempting to perform work that requires more CPU than is currently configured.

Excessive throttling can lead to performance impacts such as increased request latency (due to the workload not being able to respond in time to requests) and health flapping (because the health check is not being responded to within the configured timeout period).

targets.query: SELECT (non_negative_derivative(mean("throttling_throttled_periods"), 10s)  / non_negative_derivative(mean("throttling_periods"), 10s)) * 100 FROM "docker_container_cpu" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~  /^$env/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "server_group", "host", "environment", "container" fill(null)

panels.title: CPU Throttle

panels.description:
This panel shows the CPU consumption of the container along with the set CPU limit from the deployment. Ideally, consumption should be below the limit threshold.

Please note that the CPU limit displayed is only applicable for the app container.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("usage_total"), 1s) / 1000000 FROM "docker_container_cpu" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "server_group", "host", "container", "environment" fill(null)

SELECT mean("limit") FROM "docker_container_cpu" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "server_group", "container", "cluster", "environment" fill(null)

panels.title: CPU Usage vs CPU Limit

panels.description: Shows the sources of ingress network traffic from the last 15 minutes.
panels.title: Network Ingress Sources

panels.description: This graph shows metrics associated with the workload's logging sidecar. It will show the total number of log messages read from all containers within the workload per second (Ingested), the number of lines parsed per second (Processed), the number of lines per second that resulted in a parsing error (Errored), and the number of lines per second that were empty (Empty)

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("count"), 1s) FROM "ingested_logs" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" = 'logging' AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "host" fill(previous) offset 1

SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("count"), 1s) FROM "rate_limit_dropped_logs" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "from_container" =~ /./AND "container" = 'logging' AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "container", "cluster", "from_container", "server_group", "host" fill(previous) offset 1

panels.title: Logging Sidecar

panels.description: This graph shows metrics associated with the workload's metrics sidecar. It will show the total number of metric datapoints gathered across all containers in the workload per second (Gather),  the total number of metric datapoints that were dropped per second from the report due to either overflow or filters (Dropped), the total number of metric datapoints that were written per second to the metrics storage backend (Written), and the total number of errors per second gathering the metrics from the containers in the workload.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("metrics_gathered"), 1s) FROM "internal_agent" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "host" fill(previous) offset 1

SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("metrics_dropped"), 1s) FROM "internal_agent" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "host" fill(previous) offset 1

SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("metrics_written"), 1s) FROM "internal_agent" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "host" fill(previous) offset 1

SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("gather_errors"), 1s) FROM "internal_agent" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "host" fill(previous) offset 1

panels.title: Metrics Sidecar

panels.description: This graph shows metrics associated with the workload's logging sidecar. It will show the total number of log messages read from all containers within the workload per second (Ingested), the number of lines parsed per second (Processed), the number of lines per second that resulted in a parsing error (Errored), and the number of lines per second that were empty (Empty)
panels.title: Container Events

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "kafka.consumer-fetch-manager-metrics.records-lag" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "partition", "topic" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "kafka.consumer-fetch-manager-metrics.records-lag" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "partition", "topic" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "kafka.consumer-fetch-manager-metrics.records-lag" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "partition", "topic" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "kafka.consumer-fetch-manager-metrics.records-lag" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "partition", "topic" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "kafka.consumer-fetch-manager-metrics.records-lag" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "partition", "topic" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "kafka.consumer-fetch-manager-metrics.records-lag" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "partition", "topic" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "kafka.consumer-fetch-manager-metrics.records-lag" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "partition", "topic" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "kafka.consumer-fetch-manager-metrics.records-lag" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "partition", "topic" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "kafka.consumer-fetch-manager-metrics.records-lag" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "partition", "topic" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "kafka.consumer-fetch-manager-metrics.records-lag" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "partition", "topic" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "kafka.consumer-fetch-manager-metrics.records-lag" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "partition", "topic" fill(null)

panels.description: Error transactions per second broken down by types 4XX and 5XX

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(sum("counter"), $__interval)/$__interval_ms*1000 as s FROM "response_code_total" WHERE "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "container" = 'proxy' AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND code =~ /^4.*$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null) offset 1

SELECT non_negative_derivative(sum("counter"), $__interval)/$__interval_ms*1000 as s FROM "response_code_total" WHERE "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "container" = 'proxy' AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND code =~ /^5.*$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null) offset 1

panels.title: Error TPS

panels.description: All transactions per second

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(sum("counter"), $__interval)/$__interval_ms*1000 FROM "response_code_total" WHERE "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "container" = 'proxy' AND environment =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null) offset 1

panels.title: TPS

targets.query: SELECT sum("keyCount") as "totalKeyCount" FROM (SELECT last("counter") as "keyCount" FROM "api_key_count" WHERE ("environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" = 'proxy') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "apiKey", "host", "cluster", *) GROUP BY "apiKey"

panels.description: Shows how long go-proxy spent doing whatever it is it's configured to do. This does not count the time it takes for the upstream to respond. This may include time for processing from GSP or ID2 as well depending on how go-proxy is configured.

targets.query: SELECT mean("p99") FROM (SELECT mean("0.99") as "p99" FROM "proxy_time_summary" WHERE ("environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "container" = 'proxy' AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "host", * fill(null)) GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster"

panels.title: Proxy Processing Time p99

panels.description: Maximum response time for 99% of transactions all the way through to the API

targets.query: SELECT mean("p99") FROM (SELECT mean("0.99") as "p99" FROM "upstream_time_summary" WHERE ("environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "container" = 'proxy' AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster", "host", * fill(null)) GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster"

panels.title: Upstream Response Time p99

targets.query: SELECT last("count"), last("version") FROM "platform-connector.active" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" = 'app') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "server_group", "cluster", "environment", "version"

SELECT last("gauge"), last("version") FROM "build_info" WHERE ("application" =~ /^$app$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" = 'proxy') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "server_group", "cluster", "environment", "version"

SELECT mean("used_percent") FROM "tap_vm.disk" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "host", "path" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("read_bytes"), 1s) FROM "tap_vm.diskio" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "name", "host" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("write_bytes"), 1s) FROM "tap_vm.diskio" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "name","host" fill(null)

SELECT mean("limit_mb") * 1048576 FROM "tap_vm.diskio" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "name", "host" fill(null)

SELECT mean("used_percent") FROM "tap_vm.mem" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "environment", "cluster", "server_group", "host" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("bytes_recv"), 1s) FROM "tap_vm.net" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "interface", "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "host" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("bytes_sent"), 1s) FROM "tap_vm.net" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "container" =~ /^$container$/ AND "environment" =~ /^$env$/ AND "application" =~ /^$app$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "interface",  "environment", "container", "cluster", "server_group", "host" fill(null)
